title: co.combinatorics - Recursive method to construct self-dual codes
body: I'm looking for the recursive methods of constructing self-dual binary codes. Recently, I found an interesting way to constructing such codes here . In this method, by using $[2n,n,d]$ self-dual code, we can construct the $[2(n+1),n+1,d']$ self-dual code. I constructed thousands of these binary self-dual codes, but I saw that $d' \leq d$ . Now my question is: Can we find some codes with this method such that $d'>d$ ? Or, Are there exist another methods to construct $[2(n+1),n+1,d']$ self-dual code from $[2n,n,d]$ self-dual code such away that $d'>d$ ? co.combinatorics coding-theory Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jun 15, 2020 at 7:27 Community Bot 1 2 2 silver badges 3 3 bronze badges asked Feb 2, 2017 at 12:31 Meysam Ghahramani 507 3 3 silver badges 19 19 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 2 1 $\begingroup$ Just a comment, Patrick Sole might be a good person to email and ask. $\endgroup$ kodlu –  kodlu 2017-02-17 23:10:06 +00:00 Commented Feb 17, 2017 at 23:10 $\begingroup$ @kodlu, Thanks for your comment.
